# Markdown & Code Chunk Reference Table

| **Feature Type** | **Purpose** | **Syntax / Example** | **What It Does** |
|------------------|-------------|-----------------------|-------------------|
| **Heading** | Create section titles | `# Heading 1`<br>`## Heading 2` | Adds structured headings (H1, H2 â€¦) |
| **Bold Text** | Emphasize strong points | `**bold text**` | Makes text **bold** |
| **Italic Text** | Emphasize mild points | `*italic text*` | Makes text *italic* |
| **Bullet List** | Create unordered lists | `- item`<br>`* item` | Displays bullet points |
| **Numbered List** | Ordered sequence | `1. First`<br>`2. Second` | Displays numbered lists |
| **Inline Code** | Show small code snippets | `` `mean(x)` `` | Formats text as `mean(x)` |
| **Link** | Add hyperlinks | `[RStudio](https://rstudio.com)` | Creates clickable links |
| **Image** | Insert an image | `![](image.png)` | Displays an image |
| **Horizontal Rule** | Visual separation | `---` | Inserts a horizontal line |
| **R Code Chunk** | Run R code inside document | ```` ```{r} code ``` ```` | Executes R code when knitted |
| **Hide Code** | Show output only | ```` ```{r, echo=FALSE} ``` ```` | Runs code but hides it |
| **Hide Warnings** | Clean output | ```` ```{r, warning=FALSE} ``` ```` | Suppresses warnings |
| **Hide Messages** | Clean output | ```` ```{r, message=FALSE} ``` ```` | Suppresses messages (e.g., from libraries) |
| **Do Not Run Chunk** | Show code but skip running | ```` ```{r, eval=FALSE} ``` ```` | Displays code without execution |
| **Chunk Labeling** | Name chunks for reference | ```` ```{r load-data} ``` ```` | Labels chunk as `load-data` |
| **Insert Table** | Display a dataframe | ```` ```{r} head(df) ``` ```` | Renders a table in output |

## R Markdown

- This is an **R Markdown** document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

- When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r,echo=TRUE,eval=TRUE,warning=FALSE,message=FALSE}
data <- data.frame(
  ID = 1:10,
  Name = c("Alice", "Bob", "Charlie", "David", "Emily", "Frank", "Grace", "Henry", "Isabella", "Jack"),
  Age = c(25, 32, 28, 41, 29, 35, 27, 38, 31, 26),
  City = c("New York", "Los Angeles", "Chicago", "Houston", "Philadelphia", "Phoenix", "San Antonio", "San Diego", "Dallas", "San Jose")
)
data
```


```{r,,warning=FALSE}
summary(data$Age)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:
```{r,echo=FALSE,eval=TRUE,warning=FALSE,message=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
ggplot(data, aes(x = Age)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 5, fill = "skyblue", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Age Distribution", x = "Age", y = "Frequency")
```
